website_summaries.verdict: Heavier than tubed tires and tricky to mount, but this tire could be a solution to debris-heavy roads.
pros: Fairly easy to mount, thanks to being true to advertised size
Provides a comfortable ride at a lower p.s.i., and can be springy at higher p.s.i
Seals small punctures quickly, with hardly a blip in speed
cons: A pretty heavy tire for its size
Mounting can be touchy, as with all tubeless tires

customer_reviews.title: 32 measure 28 mm
customer_reviews.text: In the past, i've used Hutchinson Fusion & Schwalbe Pro One Tubeless tires. The Sectors are by far the easiest to to mount, but did required compressed air to get them to seal. First day they leaked down 10 psi, but after that they are maintaining pressure. Size... Tire say 32, but they measure 28 mm. The same size width as the 28's I removed. 12.6 ID Rim
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Great gravel grinder tire
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly durable tire. I raced the Belgian Waffle Ride on these tires and they held up superbly. I ran them with tubes, while a buddy with tubeless rims ran them with Stan's. The tires handled deep sand, rock gardens, rocky climbs and decents with ease. Obviously they don't provide the traction of a knobbed tire, but for a course that flips constantly from road to dirt they're a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: This tire punctures if you look at it funny.
customer_reviews.text: Hutchinson can check my order history and see that I've ordered 5 of these tires in the last three months. After the first two catastrophic punctures I figured I was just having bad luck. The third and I started to suspect the tire was as about as durable as wet rice-paper. Today I've had a 4th big puncture which confirmed my suspicions. All while commuting on a roadbike on city streets with the tires set to listed sidewall pressure. I'm down to my last spare Hutchinson Sector 28 700c tire. When it most likely punctures next week I'll be looking to someone other than Hutchinson for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love these big fat road tires.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I thought I'd use these as winter training tires, but I like them so much I may stick with them. I use my cyclocross bike as a road bike with a set of wheels dedicated to road riding. I thought these would feel heavy, but my segment times on my normal road routes are not affected and the ride is extremely smooth. I weigh over 200 pounds and can run these tires at 46 psi front and 48 psi rear.
customer_reviews.author: Smarkeaux

customer_reviews.title: Great tire, great handling
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the stock wheels and tires on my Trek 4.3 with Stans Notubes A340 wheels and Hutchinson Sector 28 tires. The combined effect was a 1.75 lb reduction in weight. These tires are great on rough roads. I have ridden over some pretty rough patches, small holes, cracks, and I think I would have been in trouble with lesser tires. Handling is very predictable. They ride more smoothly than my original tires. Tubeless really is the way to go. I only have a few hundred miles on them but they are keepers.
customer_reviews.author: KDW

customer_reviews.title: High Endurance, Smooth Rolling
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I have 28s and 32s. They wear much better than the awesome Schwalbe Pro Ones which is why I got them. I dunno if they "roll faster". Grip seems fine...that is sorta hard to test/know the limit until you are on the ground. :/
customer_reviews.author: David Colon

customer_reviews.title: Delaminated. Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: No issues initially but I recently noticed the entire tire had delaminated near the rim on both sides so I had to replace it for safety concerns. I've been riding for over 30 years and never had a tire do this. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very suspect durability
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased a set of 32s for a set of wheels. I was surprised at how easily they were to mount on my rims(tubeless). I just popped them on and pumped them up, with my floor pump, and on they went. Added Stan's and distributed sealant throughout. Pumped them to 70psi. First ride and two sidewall blowouts on the rear tire and one on the front. Very disappointed with the overall durablility and I purchased these after reading about the high quality tires
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sidwall failure on second ride
customer_reviews.text: Hit a pothole on the second ride and the sidewall failed. Won't be buying this again. Sealant was able to get me home but the tire is leaking air and needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best feeling, best handling, and most durable tire I have ever ridden. I only wish they fit in my race bike frame. They are just a hair too wide for my SuperSix Evo frame.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: comfortable. They made my Specialized Roubaix into a magic ...
customer_reviews.text: Smooth as silk, comfortable. They made my Specialized Roubaix into a magic carpet. Plus, no flats from roadside crap. I would avoid riding a tire with tube from this day forward. As far as the brand, it's a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Strattner

customer_reviews.title: very poor durability. Got one winter out of them. Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: The tires are pretty easy to mount. The issue with the tires is durability. They are prone to punctures and the seams in the rubber layup is the weak point. Can't recommend
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Durable with a solid bead
customer_reviews.text: I commute on these tires on pretty bad bikes paths littered with glass and general trash. They hold up very well
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: ... riden this tire a few times now and I like it very much
customer_reviews.text: I have riden this tire a few times now and I like it very much. I am running them tubeless and they grip well and feel very much like a tubular tire. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Weight Weenie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I only have a hundred miles on them ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I only have a hundred miles on them so no real test on their durability. But they mounted up easily and sealed well. And the road feel is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: I love tubeless, but check your clearance. It doesn't fit the Pinarello Dogma
customer_reviews.text: I love the tubeless. I used the 700x23 and 700x25 without a problem. i wanted to try the 700x28. Went on the wheel easier than the 700x25. Seated great....but, will not clear the rear stay. So, this tire is on another bike with more clearance. Before buying, measure twice.
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cracks in the seams
customer_reviews.text: These tires are very comfortable and light but the reduced weight comes with reduced strength. I have ridden only a few hundred miles and there is some major cracking on the upper seam around the length of the tire. I haven't even had a chance to wear off the nubs. I also noticed that the increased size reduces their ability to keep air so I have to use much more tire seal to keep it tight. I would not recommend these tires for daily training or commuting. Stay with the Hutchinson intensive.
customer_reviews.author: chris stevens

customer_reviews.title: Fast, worked good as tubeless!
customer_reviews.text: These are very fast tires with good traction, but only when going in a straight line. Uneven concrete, gravel, dirt, I wiped out twice, too much for an old man. I replaced these with Hutchinson Piranha's for safety sake.
customer_reviews.author: Don H

customer_reviews.title: Thousands of comfortable miles...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put thousands of miles on this tubeless-ready road tire, both on tarmac and gravel. Quite literally no punctures and I’m just now replacing them with the same ones after more than 4K. They’re really quite good on the road, and acceptable for light gravel and hardpack. In group rides with folks riding 23-25mm road tires I’m not at all suffering from rolling resistance. If you’re looking for a larger, more comfortable road tires for today’s modern larger capacity frames then these are worth a try and at a very moderate price point.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Picture shows Road Tubeless but what was delivered was Tubeless Ready
customer_reviews.text: The tire mounted and sealed easily. But the picture shows Road Tubeless and what was delivered was Tubeless Ready. I was replacing a Road Tubeless which is what is pictured and even though I use sealant anyway and the Tubeless Ready tire is lighter, it bugs my anal brain that I have mismatched tires on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous premature bead wear
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ridden this tire mounted to a Bontrager tlr rim for the past six months. Today it blew off the rim! On inspection the bead was damaged where it contacted the rim around the entire perimeter of the tire. Could’ve been disastrous. Hopefully this is a one off- but too scary to risk it.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Canton

customer_reviews.title: horrible pavement in Hungary and Romania (we won't even count ...
customer_reviews.text: Paris to Istanbul, 3500 km. Some gravel, plenty of pave', glass in Paris, horrible pavement in Hungary and Romania (we won't even count the dogs in Romania). Comfortable, smooth, and no flats. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Hutchinson Sector 700c Tubeless Tire
product_meta.description: While your weekend may not consist of riding the storied cobblestones of France for a chance to win the Queen of the Classics, you can still take on the bumpiest chipseal roads you encounter with the confidence of a pro racing Roubaix with Hutchinson's Sector 28 Tubeless tire. The French manufacturer developed the Sector 28 in honor of a cobblestone-filled race on its home turf, but the tire can handle more than just centuries-old stones. Using dual-compound rubber and 127tpi casing, Hutchinson created a tire that resists flatting and is dependable on rough roads, gravel, and dirt, maintains a supple ride and easy handling. The center tread is slightly firmer to encourage low rolling resistance, with softer rubber on the sides and subtle grooves in the sidewall to provide grip while cornering. Relax while riding on summer's torn-up construction zone roads without having to worry about squinting for stray nails or staples -- Hutchinson includes a thin barrier to reinforce the center tread that manages to avoid making the Sector 28s feel clunky.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
